content.description: This is a good hole. To start, climb into the hole and wiggle up. Next, bid a farewell to the warmth of the hole and claw your way out. Once out of the hole, belay your second up and traverse directly across to the tree rappel on Flanders Field. I would recommend this hole.
content.protection: Headlamp, singleÂ rack to #2/3 and maybe some nuts/tricams. Screws and spectres for an anchor.
content.location: Locate the big hole next to Flanders Field.

content.description: A long climb up a shallow gully with stemming and fun movement. The crux is the short vertical section visible from the ground. When I did it, there was enough ice to climb but not enough for great protection. It is rated "5.7" in drier conditions. There is a slung tree with rap ring at the top.
content.protection: Screws, ? for rock (was thin ice with no pro in the mixed section when I did it)
content.location:
The gully just left of Champagne Sherbe(r)t.

Turn left off the approach trail at a large clearing, cross the creek, and continue up and right to both Champagne climbs.
